p: Coronaviruses are capable of infecting humans, but their natural preferred hosts are a multitude of animal species (mammals, birds). Human coronavirus infection should be considered a zoonosis. They were first described in 1966 from the nasal secretions of a patient with rhinitis. 8, 11 Those included in the alpha-coronavirus group, such as 229E (1a) and NL63 (1b), cause mild or moderate respiratory infections, and some among the beta-coronavirus group, such as OC43 (2a) and HKU1 (2a), also cause this type of infection, whereas the rest of this subgroup, such as SARS-CoV (2b) and SARS-CoV-2 (2b) and MERS-CoV (2c), cause epidemics and severe respiratory infections. 5, 11, 12
